instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCORE_GPU: What is PPVCORE_GPU? This is the main power rail for the GPU. This is required for the GPU to turn on so you can get image on the display. .
definitions.LCD_PWR_EN: What is LCD_PWR_EN? LCD_PWR_EN is a signal that tells the chip that supplies power to the LCD screen to turn on..
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_AXG: What is PPVCORE_S0_AXG? This is vcore going to the CPUâ€™s integrated graphics processor for CPUs that have an integrated GPU. When this is missing on a device that has an integrated GPU and no discrete GPU, it usually means either no screen is detected, or the GPU integrated into the CPU is dead..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B , chimes but no signal & no backlight
threads.message:
I have two same <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B [with 216-0809000] that have same problem, they chime and even start OS [I can hear volume up/down with 10.9] but they give no signal at display and no backlight.
I have disconnected LVDS and tried with display port but without luck.
The first one had lines at display when brought in and I replaced gpu - after that the problem occured. So I reballed the vrams and reflowed the gmux also with no luck.
Next I placed back the old gpu but still nothing happened. The used new gpu had been installed at another one and worked ok [I have a good stock of them] so someting else is happening here.
The second <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B was received with the exact same issue and neither me or anyone else has meshed with it yet.
About some measurements,

<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL>  1,10 V
<SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>      0V
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_AXG</SIGNAL>  0,45 V

I have to mention that I had before one same case with 216-0810005 gpu but I had to return it as I thought that it wasn't common issue and didn't worth to spend time.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B , chimes but no signal & no backlight
threads.message:
The first board was probably a badly soldered GPU, but since you messed with the GMUX that will now probably need reballing/replacement.

The second one has not been messed with yet?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B , chimes but no signal & no backlight
threads.message:
I do a lot of bga rework so it would hardly be bad soldering.
Yes, for the second one I haven't spent any time by replacing the chip of anything else as I'm sure there's something else happening here.
The only thing I got some measurements that match with the first board.
Any hints where to start?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B , chimes but no signal & no backlight
threads.message: First see if the second board works on external display. I assume you have heated up the GPU to make sure it is not just a simple bad chip.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B , chimes but no signal & no backlight
threads.message:
I had it tested with external display but I hadn't heated it.I did some heating and display came alive! Now I'm replacing the chip.
I didn't have any similar issue with no display because of gpu at this model so it wasn't my practice to heat them.
Any hope for the first board also or not?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B , chimes but no signal & no backlight
threads.message:
Second worked ok.
Leave the first one, too much time waisted here, I'm returning it.
